Question
========
We derived the following figures for the variable ‘age’ from a random
sample: number of respondents 200, mean 46.1340, standard error 0.11751,
standard deviation 1.66179.  
  
What is the z-score of a 44 year old person?

Answerlist
----------
* (44-46.1340)/1.66179
* (46.1340-44)/1.66179
* (44-46.1340)/0.11751
* (44-46.1340)/2.762

Solution
========





 formula **z = (x - μ) / σ** where x is your data point, μ is the mean,
and σ is the standard deviation




Answerlist
----------
* True
* False
* False
* False
